api_list.description:
Discover movies by different types of data like average rating, number of votes, genres and certifications. You can get a valid list of certifications from the [certifications list](#endpoint:faFKjuKG2HnwexAWM) method.

Discover also supports a nice list of sort options. See below for all of the available options.

Please note, when using `certification` \ `certification.lte` you must also specify `certification_country`. These two parameters work together in order to filter the results. You can only filter results with the countries we have added to our [certifications list](#endpoint:faFKjuKG2HnwexAWM).

If you specify the `region` parameter, the regional release date will be used instead of the primary release date. The date returned will be the first date based on your query (ie. if a `with_release_type` is specified). It's important to note the order of the release types that are used. Specifying "2|3" would return the limited theatrical release date as opposed to "3|2" which would return the theatrical date.

Also note that a number of filters support being comma (`,`) or pipe (`|`) separated. Comma's are treated like an `AND` and query while pipe's are an `OR`. 

Some examples of what can be done with discover can be found [here](https://www.themoviedb.org/documentation/api/discover).

api_list.description:
Get the daily or weekly trending items. The daily trending list tracks items over the period of a day while items have a 24 hour half life. The weekly list tracks items over a 7 day period, with a 7 day half life.

#### Valid Media Types

| **Media Type** | **Description** |
| - | - |
| all | Include all movies, TV shows and people in the results as a global trending list. |
| movie | Show the trending movies in the results. |
| tv | Show the trending TV shows in the results. |
| person | Show the trending people in the results. |

#### Valid Time Windows

| **Time Window** | **Description** |
| - | - |
| day | View the trending list for the day. |
| week | View the trending list for the week. |

required_parameters.name: media_type
required_parameters.description: the media type

required_parameters.name: time_window
required_parameters.description: the time window

api_list.description:
Discover TV shows by different types of data like average rating, number of votes, genres, the network they aired on and air dates.

Discover also supports a nice list of sort options. See below for all of the available options.

Also note that a number of filters support being comma (`,`) or pipe (`|`) separated. Comma's are treated like an `AND` and query while pipe's are an `OR`. 

Some examples of what can be done with discover can be found [here](https://www.themoviedb.org/documentation/api/discover).

required_parameters.name: sort_by
required_parameters.description: Choose from one of the many available sort options.

required_parameters.name: air_date.gte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include TV shows that have a air date (by looking at all episodes) that is greater or equal to the specified value.

required_parameters.name: air_date.lte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include TV shows that have a air date (by looking at all episodes) that is less than or equal to the specified value.

required_parameters.name: first_air_date.gte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include TV shows that have a original air date that is greater or equal to the specified value. Can be used in conjunction with the "include_null_first_air_dates" filter if you want to include items with no air date.

required_parameters.name: first_air_date.lte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include TV shows that have a original air date that is less than or equal to the specified value. Can be used in conjunction with the "include_null_first_air_dates" filter if you want to include items with no air date.

required_parameters.name: first_air_date_year
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include TV shows that have a original air date year that equal to the specified value. Can be used in conjunction with the "include_null_first_air_dates" filter if you want to include items with no air date.

required_parameters.name: page
required_parameters.description: Specify the page of results to query.

required_parameters.name: timezone
required_parameters.description: Used in conjunction with the air_date.gte/lte filter to calculate the proper UTC offset.

required_parameters.name: vote_average.gte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include movies that have a rating that is greater or equal to the specified value.

required_parameters.name: vote_count.gte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include movies that have a rating that is less than or equal to the specified value.

required_parameters.name: with_genres
required_parameters.description: Comma separated value of genre ids that you want to include in the results.

required_parameters.name: with_networks
required_parameters.description: Comma separated value of network ids that you want to include in the results.

required_parameters.name: without_genres
required_parameters.description: Comma separated value of genre ids that you want to exclude from the results.

required_parameters.name: with_runtime.gte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include TV shows with an episode runtime that is greater than or equal to a value.

required_parameters.name: with_runtime.lte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include TV shows with an episode runtime that is less than or equal to a value.

required_parameters.name: include_null_first_air_dates
required_parameters.description: Use this filter to include TV shows that don't have an air date while using any of the "first_air_date" filters.

required_parameters.name: with_original_language
required_parameters.description: Specify an ISO 639-1 string to filter results by their original language value.

required_parameters.name: without_keywords
required_parameters.description: Exclude items with certain keywords. You can comma and pipe seperate these values to create an 'AND' or 'OR' logic.

required_parameters.name: screened_theatrically
required_parameters.description: Filter results to include items that have been screened theatrically.

required_parameters.name: with_companies
required_parameters.description: A comma separated list of production company ID's. Only include movies that have one of the ID's added as a production company.

required_parameters.name: with_keywords
required_parameters.description: A comma separated list of keyword ID's. Only includes TV shows that have one of the ID's added as a keyword.

required_parameters.name: with_watch_providers
required_parameters.description: A comma or pipe separated list of watch provider ID's. Combine this filter with `watch_region` in order to filter your results by a specific watch provider in a specific region.

required_parameters.name: watch_region
required_parameters.description: An ISO 3166-1 code. Combine this filter with `with_watch_providers` in order to filter your results by a specific watch provider in a specific region.

required_parameters.name: with_watch_monetization_types
required_parameters.description: In combination with `watch_region`, you can filter by monetization type.

required_parameters.name: with_status
required_parameters.description:
Filter TV shows by their status.

Returning Series: 0
Planned: 1
In Production: 2
Ended: 3
Cancelled: 4
Pilot: 5

required_parameters.name: with_type
required_parameters.description:
Filter TV shows by their type.

Documentary: 0
News: 1
Miniseries: 2
Reality: 3
Scripted: 4
Talk Show: 5
Video: 6

required_parameters.name: without_companies
required_parameters.description: Filter the results to exclude the specific production companies you specify here. `AND` / `OR` filters are supported.

api_list.description:
Discover movies by different types of data like average rating, number of votes, genres and certifications. You can get a valid list of certifications from the [certifications list](#endpoint:faFKjuKG2HnwexAWM) method.

Discover also supports a nice list of sort options. See below for all of the available options.

Please note, when using `certification` \ `certification.lte` you must also specify `certification_country`. These two parameters work together in order to filter the results. You can only filter results with the countries we have added to our [certifications list](#endpoint:faFKjuKG2HnwexAWM).

If you specify the `region` parameter, the regional release date will be used instead of the primary release date. The date returned will be the first date based on your query (ie. if a `with_release_type` is specified). It's important to note the order of the release types that are used. Specifying "2|3" would return the limited theatrical release date as opposed to "3|2" which would return the theatrical date.

Also note that a number of filters support being comma (`,`) or pipe (`|`) separated. Comma's are treated like an `AND` and query while pipe's are an `OR`. 

Some examples of what can be done with discover can be found [here](https://www.themoviedb.org/documentation/api/discover).

required_parameters.name: region
required_parameters.description: Specify a ISO 3166-1 code to filter release dates. Must be uppercase.

required_parameters.description: Choose from one of the many available sort options.

required_parameters.description: Used in conjunction with the certification filter, use this to specify a country with a valid certification.

required_parameters.name: certification
required_parameters.description: Filter results with a valid certification from the 'certification_country' field.

required_parameters.description: Filter and only include movies that have a certification that is less than or equal to the specified value.

required_parameters.description: Filter and only include movies that have a certification that is greater than or equal to the specified value.

api_list.description:
Get the daily or weekly trending items. The daily trending list tracks items over the period of a day while items have a 24 hour half life. The weekly list tracks items over a 7 day period, with a 7 day half life.

#### Valid Media Types

| **Media Type** | **Description** |
| - | - |
| all | Include all movies, TV shows and people in the results as a global trending list. |
| movie | Show the trending movies in the results. |
| tv | Show the trending TV shows in the results. |
| person | Show the trending people in the results. |

#### Valid Time Windows

| **Time Window** | **Description** |
| - | - |
| day | View the trending list for the day. |
| week | View the trending list for the week. |

required_parameters.name: media_type
required_parameters.description: the media type

required_parameters.name: time_window
required_parameters.description: the time window

api_list.description:
Discover movies by different types of data like average rating, number of votes, genres and certifications. You can get a valid list of certifications from the [certifications list](#endpoint:faFKjuKG2HnwexAWM) method.

Discover also supports a nice list of sort options. See below for all of the available options.

Please note, when using `certification` \ `certification.lte` you must also specify `certification_country`. These two parameters work together in order to filter the results. You can only filter results with the countries we have added to our [certifications list](#endpoint:faFKjuKG2HnwexAWM).

If you specify the `region` parameter, the regional release date will be used instead of the primary release date. The date returned will be the first date based on your query (ie. if a `with_release_type` is specified). It's important to note the order of the release types that are used. Specifying "2|3" would return the limited theatrical release date as opposed to "3|2" which would return the theatrical date.

Also note that a number of filters support being comma (`,`) or pipe (`|`) separated. Comma's are treated like an `AND` and query while pipe's are an `OR`. 

Some examples of what can be done with discover can be found [here](https://www.themoviedb.org/documentation/api/discover).

required_parameters.name: region
required_parameters.description: Specify a ISO 3166-1 code to filter release dates. Must be uppercase.

required_parameters.name: sort_by
required_parameters.description: Choose from one of the many available sort options.

required_parameters.name: certification_country
required_parameters.description: Used in conjunction with the certification filter, use this to specify a country with a valid certification.

required_parameters.name: certification
required_parameters.description: Filter results with a valid certification from the 'certification_country' field.

required_parameters.name: certification.lte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include movies that have a certification that is less than or equal to the specified value.

required_parameters.name: certification.gte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include movies that have a certification that is greater than or equal to the specified value.

required_parameters.name: include_adult
required_parameters.description: A filter and include or exclude adult movies.

required_parameters.name: include_video
required_parameters.description: A filter to include or exclude videos.

required_parameters.name: page
required_parameters.description: Specify the page of results to query.

required_parameters.name: primary_release_year
required_parameters.description: A filter to limit the results to a specific primary release year.

required_parameters.name: primary_release_date.gte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include movies that have a primary release date that is greater or equal to the specified value.

required_parameters.name: primary_release_date.lte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include movies that have a primary release date that is less than or equal to the specified value.

required_parameters.name: release_date.gte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include movies that have a release date (looking at all release dates) that is greater or equal to the specified value.

required_parameters.name: release_date.lte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include movies that have a release date (looking at all release dates) that is less than or equal to the specified value.

required_parameters.name: with_release_type
required_parameters.description: Specify a comma (AND) or pipe (OR) separated value to filter release types by. These release types map to the same values found on the movie release date method.

required_parameters.name: year
required_parameters.description: A filter to limit the results to a specific year (looking at all release dates).

required_parameters.name: vote_count.gte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include movies that have a vote count that is greater or equal to the specified value.

required_parameters.name: vote_count.lte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include movies that have a vote count that is less than or equal to the specified value.

required_parameters.name: vote_average.gte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include movies that have a rating that is greater or equal to the specified value.

required_parameters.name: vote_average.lte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include movies that have a rating that is less than or equal to the specified value.

required_parameters.name: with_cast
required_parameters.description: A comma separated list of person ID's. Only include movies that have one of the ID's added as an actor.

required_parameters.name: with_crew
required_parameters.description: A comma separated list of person ID's. Only include movies that have one of the ID's added as a crew member.

required_parameters.name: with_people
required_parameters.description: A comma separated list of person ID's. Only include movies that have one of the ID's added as a either a actor or a crew member.

required_parameters.name: with_companies
required_parameters.description: A comma separated list of production company ID's. Only include movies that have one of the ID's added as a production company.

required_parameters.name: with_genres
required_parameters.description: Comma separated value of genre ids that you want to include in the results.

required_parameters.name: without_genres
required_parameters.description: Comma separated value of genre ids that you want to exclude from the results.

required_parameters.name: with_keywords
required_parameters.description: A comma separated list of keyword ID's. Only includes movies that have one of the ID's added as a keyword.

required_parameters.name: without_keywords
required_parameters.description: Exclude items with certain keywords. You can comma and pipe seperate these values to create an 'AND' or 'OR' logic.

required_parameters.name: with_runtime.gte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include movies that have a runtime that is greater or equal to a value.

required_parameters.name: with_runtime.lte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include movies that have a runtime that is less than or equal to a value.

required_parameters.name: with_original_language
required_parameters.description: Specify an ISO 639-1 string to filter results by their original language value.

required_parameters.name: with_watch_providers
required_parameters.description: A comma or pipe separated list of watch provider ID's. Combine this filter with `watch_region` in order to filter your results by a specific watch provider in a specific region.

required_parameters.name: watch_region
required_parameters.description: An ISO 3166-1 code. Combine this filter with `with_watch_providers` in order to filter your results by a specific watch provider in a specific region.

required_parameters.name: with_watch_monetization_types
required_parameters.description: In combination with `watch_region`, you can filter by monetization type.

required_parameters.name: without_companies
required_parameters.description: Filter the results to exclude the specific production companies you specify here. `AND` / `OR` filters are supported.

api_list.description:
Discover TV shows by different types of data like average rating, number of votes, genres, the network they aired on and air dates.

Discover also supports a nice list of sort options. See below for all of the available options.

Also note that a number of filters support being comma (`,`) or pipe (`|`) separated. Comma's are treated like an `AND` and query while pipe's are an `OR`. 

Some examples of what can be done with discover can be found [here](https://www.themoviedb.org/documentation/api/discover).

required_parameters.name: sort_by
required_parameters.description: Choose from one of the many available sort options.

required_parameters.name: air_date.gte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include TV shows that have a air date (by looking at all episodes) that is greater or equal to the specified value.

required_parameters.name: air_date.lte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include TV shows that have a air date (by looking at all episodes) that is less than or equal to the specified value.

required_parameters.name: first_air_date.gte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include TV shows that have a original air date that is greater or equal to the specified value. Can be used in conjunction with the "include_null_first_air_dates" filter if you want to include items with no air date.

required_parameters.name: first_air_date.lte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include TV shows that have a original air date that is less than or equal to the specified value. Can be used in conjunction with the "include_null_first_air_dates" filter if you want to include items with no air date.

required_parameters.name: first_air_date_year
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include TV shows that have a original air date year that equal to the specified value. Can be used in conjunction with the "include_null_first_air_dates" filter if you want to include items with no air date.

required_parameters.name: page
required_parameters.description: Specify the page of results to query.

required_parameters.name: timezone
required_parameters.description: Used in conjunction with the air_date.gte/lte filter to calculate the proper UTC offset.

required_parameters.name: vote_average.gte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include movies that have a rating that is greater or equal to the specified value.

required_parameters.name: vote_count.gte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include movies that have a rating that is less than or equal to the specified value.

required_parameters.name: with_genres
required_parameters.description: Comma separated value of genre ids that you want to include in the results.

required_parameters.name: with_networks
required_parameters.description: Comma separated value of network ids that you want to include in the results.

required_parameters.name: without_genres
required_parameters.description: Comma separated value of genre ids that you want to exclude from the results.

required_parameters.name: with_runtime.gte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include TV shows with an episode runtime that is greater than or equal to a value.

required_parameters.name: with_runtime.lte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include TV shows with an episode runtime that is less than or equal to a value.

required_parameters.name: include_null_first_air_dates
required_parameters.description: Use this filter to include TV shows that don't have an air date while using any of the "first_air_date" filters.

required_parameters.name: with_original_language
required_parameters.description: Specify an ISO 639-1 string to filter results by their original language value.

required_parameters.name: without_keywords
required_parameters.description: Exclude items with certain keywords. You can comma and pipe seperate these values to create an 'AND' or 'OR' logic.

required_parameters.name: screened_theatrically
required_parameters.description: Filter results to include items that have been screened theatrically.

required_parameters.name: with_companies
required_parameters.description: A comma separated list of production company ID's. Only include movies that have one of the ID's added as a production company.

required_parameters.name: with_keywords

api_list.description:
Get the daily or weekly trending items. The daily trending list tracks items over the period of a day while items have a 24 hour half life. The weekly list tracks items over a 7 day period, with a 7 day half life.

#### Valid Media Types

| **Media Type** | **Description** |
| - | - |
| all | Include all movies, TV shows and people in the results as a global trending list. |
| movie | Show the trending movies in the results. |
| tv | Show the trending TV shows in the results. |
| person | Show the trending people in the results. |

#### Valid Time Windows

| **Time Window** | **Description** |
| - | - |
| day | View the trending list for the day. |
| week | View the trending list for the week. |

api_list.description:
Discover movies by different types of data like average rating, number of votes, genres and certifications. You can get a valid list of certifications from the [certifications list](#endpoint:faFKjuKG2HnwexAWM) method.

Discover also supports a nice list of sort options. See below for all of the available options.

Please note, when using `certification` \ `certification.lte` you must also specify `certification_country`. These two parameters work together in order to filter the results. You can only filter results with the countries we have added to our [certifications list](#endpoint:faFKjuKG2HnwexAWM).

If you specify the `region` parameter, the regional release date will be used instead of the primary release date. The date returned will be the first date based on your query (ie. if a `with_release_type` is specified). It's important to note the order of the release types that are used. Specifying "2|3" would return the limited theatrical release date as opposed to "3|2" which would return the theatrical date.

Also note that a number of filters support being comma (`,`) or pipe (`|`) separated. Comma's are treated like an `AND` and query while pipe's are an `OR`. 

Some examples of what can be done with discover can be found [here](https://www.themoviedb.org/documentation/api/discover).

required_parameters.name: region
required_parameters.description: Specify a ISO 3166-1 code to filter release dates. Must be uppercase.

required_parameters.name: sort_by
required_parameters.description: Choose from one of the many available sort options.

required_parameters.name: certification_country
required_parameters.description: Used in conjunction with the certification filter, use this to specify a country with a valid certification.

required_parameters.name: certification
required_parameters.description: Filter results with a valid certification from the 'certification_country' field.

required_parameters.name: certification.lte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include movies that have a certification that is less than or equal to the specified value.

required_parameters.name: certification.gte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include movies that have a certification that is greater than or equal to the specified value.

required_parameters.name: include_adult
required_parameters.description: A filter and include or exclude adult movies.

required_parameters.name: include_video
required_parameters.description: A filter to include or exclude videos.

required_parameters.name: page
required_parameters.description: Specify the page of results to query.

required_parameters.name: primary_release_year
required_parameters.description: A filter to limit the results to a specific primary release year.

required_parameters.name: primary_release_date.gte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include movies that have a primary release date that is greater or equal to the specified value.

required_parameters.name: primary_release_date.lte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include movies that have a primary release date that is less than or equal to the specified value.

required_parameters.name: release_date.gte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include movies that have a release date (looking at all release dates) that is greater or equal to the specified value.

required_parameters.name: release_date.lte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include movies that have a release date (looking at all release dates) that is less than or equal to the specified value.

required_parameters.name: with_release_type
required_parameters.description: Specify a comma (AND) or pipe (OR) separated value to filter release types by. These release types map to the same values found on the movie release date method.

required_parameters.name: year
required_parameters.description: A filter to limit the results to a specific year (looking at all release dates).

required_parameters.name: vote_count.gte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include movies that have a vote count that is greater or equal to the specified value.

required_parameters.name: vote_count.lte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include movies that have a vote count that is less than or equal to the specified value.

required_parameters.name: vote_average.gte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include movies that have a rating that is greater or equal to the specified value.

required_parameters.name: vote_average.lte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include movies that have a rating that is less than or equal to the specified value.

required_parameters.name: with_cast
required_parameters.description: A comma separated list of person ID's. Only include movies that have one of the ID's added as an actor.

required_parameters.name: with_crew
required_parameters.description: A comma separated list of person ID's. Only include movies that have one of the ID's added as a crew member.

required_parameters.name: with_people
required_parameters.description: A comma separated list of person ID's. Only include movies that have one of the ID's added as a either a actor or a crew member.

required_parameters.name: with_companies
required_parameters.description: A comma separated list of production company ID's. Only include movies that have one of the ID's added as a production company.

required_parameters.name: with_genres
required_parameters.description: Comma separated value of genre ids that you want to include in the results.

required_parameters.name: without_genres
required_parameters.description: Comma separated value of genre ids that you want to exclude from the results.

required_parameters.name: with_keywords
required_parameters.description: A comma separated list of keyword ID's. Only includes movies that have one of the ID's added as a keyword.

required_parameters.name: without_keywords
required_parameters.description: Exclude items with certain keywords. You can comma and pipe seperate these values to create an 'AND' or 'OR' logic.

required_parameters.name: with_runtime.gte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include movies that have a runtime that is greater or equal to a value.

required_parameters.name: with_runtime.lte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include movies that have a runtime that is less than or equal to a value.

required_parameters.name: with_original_language
required_parameters.description: Specify an ISO 639-1 string to filter results by their original language value.

required_parameters.name: with_watch_providers
required_parameters.description: A comma or pipe separated list of watch provider ID's. Combine this filter with `watch_region` in order to filter your results by a specific watch provider in a specific region.

required_parameters.name: watch_region
required_parameters.description: An ISO 3166-1 code. Combine this filter with `with_watch_providers` in order to filter your results by a specific watch provider in a specific region.

required_parameters.name: with_watch_monetization_types
required_parameters.description: In combination with `watch_region`, you can filter by monetization type.

required_parameters.name: without_companies
required_parameters.description: Filter the results to exclude the specific production companies you specify here. `AND` / `OR` filters are supported.

api_list.description:
Discover movies by different types of data like average rating, number of votes, genres and certifications. You can get a valid list of certifications from the [certifications list](#endpoint:faFKjuKG2HnwexAWM) method.

Discover also supports a nice list of sort options. See below for all of the available options.

Please note, when using `certification` \ `certification.lte` you must also specify `certification_country`. These two parameters work together in order to filter the results. You can only filter results with the countries we have added to our [certifications list](#endpoint:faFKjuKG2HnwexAWM).

If you specify the `region` parameter, the regional release date will be used instead of the primary release date. The date returned will be the first date based on your query (ie. if a `with_release_type` is specified). It's important to note the order of the release types that are used. Specifying "2|3" would return the limited theatrical release date as opposed to "3|2" which would return the theatrical date.

Also note that a number of filters support being comma (`,`) or pipe (`|`) separated. Comma's are treated like an `AND` and query while pipe's are an `OR`. 

Some examples of what can be done with discover can be found [here](https://www.themoviedb.org/documentation/api/discover).

api_list.description:
Get the TV network logos by id.

There are two image formats that are supported for networks, PNG's and SVG's. You can see which type the original file is by looking at the `file_type` field. We prefer SVG's as they are resolution independent and as such, the width and height are only there to reflect the original asset that was uploaded. An SVG can be scaled properly beyond those dimensions if you call them as a PNG.

For more information about how SVG's and PNG's can be used, take a read through [this document](#docTextSection:mXP9B2uzoDJFguDZv).

api_list.description:
Get a companies logos by id.

There are two image formats that are supported for companies, PNG's and SVG's. You can see which type the original file is by looking at the `file_type` field. We prefer SVG's as they are resolution independent and as such, the width and height are only there to reflect the original asset that was uploaded. An SVG can be scaled properly beyond those dimensions if you call them as a PNG.

For more information about how SVG's and PNG's can be used, take a read through [this document](#docTextSection:mXP9B2uzoDJFguDZv).

required_parameters.description: the company id

api_list.description:
Get the daily or weekly trending items. The daily trending list tracks items over the period of a day while items have a 24 hour half life. The weekly list tracks items over a 7 day period, with a 7 day half life.

#### Valid Media Types

| **Media Type** | **Description** |
| - | - |
| all | Include all movies, TV shows and people in the results as a global trending list. |
| movie | Show the trending movies in the results. |
| tv | Show the trending TV shows in the results. |
| person | Show the trending people in the results. |

#### Valid Time Windows

| **Time Window** | **Description** |
| - | - |
| day | View the trending list for the day. |
| week | View the trending list for the week. |

api_list.description:
Discover TV shows by different types of data like average rating, number of votes, genres, the network they aired on and air dates.

Discover also supports a nice list of sort options. See below for all of the available options.

Also note that a number of filters support being comma (`,`) or pipe (`|`) separated. Comma's are treated like an `AND` and query while pipe's are an `OR`. 

Some examples of what can be done with discover can be found [here](https://www.themoviedb.org/documentation/api/discover).

required_parameters.name: sort_by
required_parameters.description: Choose from one of the many available sort options.

required_parameters.name: air_date.gte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include TV shows that have a air date (by looking at all episodes) that is greater or equal to the specified value.

required_parameters.name: air_date.lte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include TV shows that have a air date (by looking at all episodes) that is less than or equal to the specified value.

required_parameters.name: first_air_date.gte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include TV shows that have a original air date that is greater or equal to the specified value. Can be used in conjunction with the "include_null_first_air_dates" filter if you want to include items with no air date.

required_parameters.name: first_air_date.lte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include TV shows that have a original air date that is less than or equal to the specified value. Can be used in conjunction with the "include_null_first_air_dates" filter if you want to include items with no air date.

required_parameters.name: first_air_date_year
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include TV shows that have a original air date year that equal to the specified value. Can be used in conjunction with the "include_null_first_air_dates" filter if you want to include items with no air date.

required_parameters.name: page
required_parameters.description: Specify the page of results to query.

required_parameters.name: timezone
required_parameters.description: Used in conjunction with the air_date.gte/lte filter to calculate the proper UTC offset.

required_parameters.name: vote_average.gte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include movies that have a rating that is greater or equal to the specified value.

required_parameters.name: vote_count.gte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include movies that have a rating that is less than or equal to the specified value.

required_parameters.name: with_genres
required_parameters.description: Comma separated value of genre ids that you want to include in the results.

required_parameters.name: with_networks
required_parameters.description: Comma separated value of network ids that you want to include in the results.

required_parameters.name: without_genres
required_parameters.description: Comma separated value of genre ids that you want to exclude from the results.

required_parameters.name: with_runtime.gte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include TV shows with an episode runtime that is greater than or equal to a value.

required_parameters.name: with_runtime.lte
required_parameters.description: Filter and only include TV shows with an episode runtime that is less than or equal to a value.

required_parameters.name: include_null_first_air_dates
required_parameters.description: Use this filter to include TV shows that don't have an air date while using any of the "first_air_date" filters.

required_parameters.name: with_original_language
required_parameters.description: Specify an ISO 639-1 string to filter results by their original language value.

required_parameters.name: without_keywords
required_parameters.description: Exclude items with certain keywords. You can comma and pipe seperate these values to create an 'AND' or 'OR' logic.

required_parameters.name: screened_theatrically
required_parameters.description: Filter results to include items that have been screened theatrically.

required_parameters.name: with_companies
required_parameters.description: A comma separated list of production company ID's. Only include movies that have one of the ID's added as a production company.

required_parameters.name: with_keywords
required_parameters.description: A comma separated list of keyword ID's. Only includes TV shows that have one of the ID's added as a keyword.

required_parameters.name: with_watch_providers
required_parameters.description: A comma or pipe separated list of watch provider ID's. Combine this filter with `watch_region` in order to filter your results by a specific watch provider in a specific region.

required_parameters.name: watch_region
required_parameters.description: An ISO 3166-1 code. Combine this filter with `with_watch_providers` in order to filter your results by a specific watch provider in a specific region.

required_parameters.name: with_watch_monetization_types
required_parameters.description: In combination with `watch_region`, you can filter by monetization type.

required_parameters.name: with_status
required_parameters.description:
Filter TV shows by their status.

Returning Series: 0
Planned: 1
In Production: 2
Ended: 3
Cancelled: 4
Pilot: 5

required_parameters.name: with_type
required_parameters.description:
Filter TV shows by their type.

Documentary: 0
News: 1
Miniseries: 2
Reality: 3
Scripted: 4
Talk Show: 5
Video: 6

required_parameters.name: without_companies
required_parameters.description: Filter the results to exclude the specific production companies you specify here. `AND` / `OR` filters are supported.

api_list.description:
Get the TV network logos by id.

There are two image formats that are supported for networks, PNG's and SVG's. You can see which type the original file is by looking at the `file_type` field. We prefer SVG's as they are resolution independent and as such, the width and height are only there to reflect the original asset that was uploaded. An SVG can be scaled properly beyond those dimensions if you call them as a PNG.

For more information about how SVG's and PNG's can be used, take a read through [this document](#docTextSection:mXP9B2uzoDJFguDZv).

api_list.description:
Discover movies by different types of data like average rating, number of votes, genres and certifications. You can get a valid list of certifications from the [certifications list](#endpoint:faFKjuKG2HnwexAWM) method.

Discover also supports a nice list of sort options. See below for all of the available options.

Please note, when using `certification` \ `certification.lte` you must also specify `certification_country`. These two parameters work together in order to filter the results. You can only filter results with the countries we have added to our [certifications list](#endpoint:faFKjuKG2HnwexAWM).

If you specify the `region` parameter, the regional release date will be used instead of the primary release date. The date returned will be the first date based on your query (ie. if a `with_release_type` is specified). It's important to note the order of the release types that are used. Specifying "2|3" would return the limited theatrical release date as opposed to "3|2" which would return the theatrical date.

Also note that a number of filters support being comma (`,`) or pipe (`|`) separated. Comma's are treated like an `AND` and query while pipe's are an `OR`. 

Some examples of what can be done with discover can be found [here](https://www.themoviedb.org/documentation/api/discover).

api_list.description:
Get the daily or weekly trending items. The daily trending list tracks items over the period of a day while items have a 24 hour half life. The weekly list tracks items over a 7 day period, with a 7 day half life.

#### Valid Media Types

| **Media Type** | **Description** |
| - | - |
| all | Include all movies, TV shows and people in the results as a global trending list. |
| movie | Show the trending movies in the results. |
| tv | Show the trending TV shows in the results. |
| person | Show the trending people in the results. |

#### Valid Time Windows

| **Time Window** | **Description** |
| - | - |
| day | View the trending list for the day. |
| week | View the trending list for the week. |

required_parameters.description: the media type
